‚ÄúSome napkin math told us that getting people to buy a $20 book is way less advantageous than getting a small percentage of those free readers to subscribe to our newsletter for $200/year.‚Äù

A big fan of Chris Lochhead and his category thinking .. this from a substack newsletter that is exploring what different people are doing to grow their business.

content.html:
John Naughton

Churchill was witty in his public disparagement of him. (E.g. ‚ÄúA modest man with much to be modest about.‚Äù ‚ÄúAn empty taxi drew up and Clement Attlee got out.‚Äù) But he knew better than anyone what a formidable operator Attlee was.

He then references a limerick which is sometimes attributed to Churchill.

There were few who thought him a starter,
And many who thought themselves smarter.
But he ended up PM, CH and OM,
An Earl and a Knight of the Garter.

And then goes on ‚Ä¶.

It‚Äôs not inconceivable that people might write about Keir Starmer in these terms in a century from now. We shall just have to wait and see.

Umm - really? I‚Äôm not seeing it ‚Ä¶ yet. (John does provide a suitable waiting period!).

‚Ä¶ then again - as much as I am not an artist, neither am I a political historian.
content.value:
John Naughton

Churchill was witty in his public disparagement of him. (E.g. ‚ÄúA modest man with much to be modest about.‚Äù ‚ÄúAn empty taxi drew up and Clement Attlee got out.‚Äù) But he knew better than anyone what a formidable operator Attlee was.

He then references a limerick which is sometimes attributed to Churchill.

There were few who thought him a starter,  
And many who thought themselves smarter.  
But he ended up PM, CH and OM,  
An Earl and a Knight of the Garter.

And then goes on ‚Ä¶.

It‚Äôs not inconceivable that people might write about Keir Starmer in these terms in a century from now. We shall just have to wait and see.

Umm - really? I‚Äôm not seeing it ‚Ä¶ yet. (John does provide a suitable waiting period!).
‚Ä¶ then again - as much as I am not an artist, neither am I a political historian.

content.html:
I always liked Rackham‚Äôs art since I was introduced to it as a teenager.

Peter Pan in Kensington Gardens is a lovely - gorgeously illustrated piece containing this gem.

‚ÄúA year later, Rackham would revolutionize the technology and economics of book art with his Alice in Wonderland illustrations; Peter Pan became the R&D lab for his revolution, working within the limitations of the three-color printing process then available to create worlds of wonder with his meticulous ink lines, populating London‚Äôs familiar landscapes and places with otherworldly creatures of haunting tenderness and strangeness ‚Äî Shakespearean fairies and talking mice and, of course, his signature enchanted trees.‚Äù

I never really thought that about someone like Rackham revolutionizing technology ‚Ä¶ and having a ‚Äòlab‚Äô - but that‚Äôs my ignorance and lack of understanding of the process of art. Makes total sense.
content.value:

I never really thought that about someone like Rackham revolutionizing technology ‚Ä¶ and having a ‚Äòlab‚Äô - but that‚Äôs my ignorance and lack of understanding of the process of art. Makes total sense.
